definition: to hold/to contain/to ladle/to pick up with a utensil
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Last year saw brands embracing innovative online video campaigns like never before.
sentences.chinese: 就在去年，各厂商纷纷拥抱创新视频营销，盛况空前。

sentences.english: Every goat year, waves of pilgrims come to the Holy Lake. It is really an exceptionally grand occasion.
sentences.chinese: 每逢羊年转湖的朝圣者人流如潮，盛况空前。

sentences.english: The 52 performances saw thousands of audience, which was the first time in history.
sentences.chinese: 先后52场的演出，观众达数十万人，盛况空前。

definition: the multitudes come out from everywhere, emptying every alleyway (to celebrate)/the whole town turns out
lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
surrounded by distinguished friends (idiom); in company
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
to congregate in one hall (idiom); to gather under one roof
guests filled all the seats (idiom); a house full of distinguished visitors
lit. rubbing shoulders and following in each other's footsteps/a thronging crowd
front yard as busy as a marketplace (idiom)/a place with many visitors
